title: Well-posedness and strong attractors for a beam model with degenerate nonlocal strong damping. (arXiv:2211.00287v2 [math.AP] UPDATED)
description: This paper is devoted to initial-boundary value problem of an extensible beam equation with degenerate nonlocal energy damping in $\Omega\subset\mathbb{R}^n$: $u_{tt}-\kappa\Delta u+\Delta^2u-\gamma(\Vert \Delta u\Vert^2+\Vert u_t\Vert^2)^q\Delta u_t+f(u)=0$. We prove the global existence and uniqueness of weak solutions, which gives a positive answer to an open question in [24]. Moreover, we establish the existence of a strong attractor for the corresponding weak solution semigroup, where the ``strong" means that the compactness and attractiveness of the attractor are in the topology of a stronger space $\mathcal{H}_{\frac{1}{q}}$.
dc:creator: Senlin Yan, Chengkui Zhong
